subject: java.lang.Exception: No runnable methods
msgSnippet: Hi, I have a superclass that implements a @BeforClass method. As I tryed to run the subclass test, all the setup stuff was OK, but then came this exception
messageBody:
Hi,

I have a superclass that implements a @BeforClass method. As I tryed
to run the subclass test, all the setup stuff was OK, but then came
this exception with the no runnable method message.. The most weird
was that the stack trace came from the test method (in the junit
plugin from eclipse IDE), which is a runnable method!

I tryed then to make the superclass extend TestCase and run it with
junit 3, and noticed that one non initialized attribute at the
superclass lead to a NullPointerException at the contructor and
somehow JUnit4 hides the exception and show only "no runnable
methods". Could it be a problem?

regards,
Ricardo Cavalcanti
